event.title: Hitler's 'Mein Kampf' found in Hamas base in Gaza - Israeli President Herzog
event.description: Inside the well-thumbed copy of Mein Kampf were margin notes, highlighted sections, and annotated Post-it notes.

sourceRef.title: Herzog: 'Mein Kampf' found at Hamas stronghold
sourceRef.description: President Isaac Herzog revealed in an interview with the British BBC network's Laura Kuenssberg that IDF forces found Adolf Hitler's book "Mein Kampf" in a children's room in a civilian home that served as a terrorist base for Hamas in the Gaza Strip.

sourceRef.title: Hitler's 'Mein Kampf' found in Hamas base in Gaza - Israeli President Herzog
sourceRef.description: 'The terrorist studied again and again the ideology of Adolf Hitler to hate the Jews, to kill the Jews. This is the real war we are facing' - Click the link for more.

sourceRef.title: Arabic copy of Adolf Hitler’s ‘Mein Kampf’ found inside child’s room in Gaza
sourceRef.description: Israel military forces said they uncovered a copy of Adolf Hitler's "Mein Kampf," translated into Arabic, inside a child's bedroom at a Hamas terror base in the Gaza Strip -- with "annotations and highlights."

blindspotData.coverageProfileSubStatement: This news story is a blindspot for people who are on the left

firstSource.title: 'Hamas learnt Hitler's ideology of hating Jews': Israel President Isaac Herzog says fighter found with copy of Mein Kamp

firstTenSources.description: Israeli President Isaac Herzog revealed in an interview that Israeli Defence Forces (IDF) found a copy of Adolf Hitler's 'Mein Kampf' translated into Arabic in a child's bedroom at a Hamas base in Gaza. The IDF condemned Hamas for allegedly embracing Hitler's ideology. Israel has drawn parallels between recent terror attacks by Hamas and the Holocaust. Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and US President Joe Biden have both condemned Hamas…
firstTenSources.title: IDF discovers 'Mein Kampf' in Hamas base, draws parallels to the Holocaust

firstTenSources.description: Isaac Herzog told the BBC that Hitler's book was found at a site used by Hamas in northern Gaza.
firstTenSources.title: Israeli president challenged on air strikes and says Mein Kampf found on Hamas fighter

firstTenSources.description: Israel's President Isaac Herzog abruptly reached for an Arabic translation of the Nazi leader's book during an interview with the BBC this morning.
firstTenSources.title: BBC's Kuenssberg taken aback after Israeli President brandishes Mein Kampf

firstTenSources.description: An Arabic copy of Adolf Hitler's book 'Mein Kampf" was discovered by Israeli military personnel on Sunday in a children's room that had been used by Hamas operatives in northern Gaza as a base during the weekend. The official account of Israel took to X, formerly Twitter and wrote, "Antisemitism kills. IDF forces found a copy of Hitler's antisemitic work "Mein Kampf" in a child's room of a home in Gaza used by Hamas as a terrorism hub." They sai…
firstTenSources.title: Israel Discovers Copy Of Hitler's Book In Children's Room Used By Hamas

firstTenSources.description: Israel military forces said they uncovered a copy of Adolf Hitler's "Mein Kampf," translated into Arabic, inside a child's bedroom at a Hamas terror base in the Gaza Strip -- with "annotations and highlights."
firstTenSources.title: Arabic copy of Adolf Hitler’s ‘Mein Kampf’ found inside child’s room in Gaza

firstTenSources.description: The IDF found an Arabic translation of Hitler’s magnum opus in a Palestinian child’s bedroom, President Isaac Herzog told BBC
firstTenSources.title: Israeli president claims ‘Mein Kampf’ found in 'children's room' in Gaza

firstTenSources.description:
Israeli troops have found an Arabic copy of Adolf Hitler’s book “Mein Kampf” in a children’s room in a house that Hamas used as a terrorism hub in Gaza, the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) said on Sunday.
The IDF stated on X that the book contains “annotations and highlights” and that it was found among the personal belongings of a Hamas terrorist during a raid in northern Gaza.
“Never again is NOW,” the Israeli military said on Nov. 12. “Hamas embr…
firstTenSources.title: Copy of Hitler's Book 'Mein Kampf' Found in Children's Room Used by Hamas: IDF

firstTenSources.description: Isaac Duke: “Terrorist wrote notes, marked chapters and studied Adolf Hitler's ideology again and again”
firstTenSources.originalDescription: Ісаак Герцог: «Терорист писав нотатки, розмічав розділи і знову і знову вивчав ідеологію Адольфа Гітлера»
firstTenSources.title: Israeli President Shows Hitler's “Mine Camp” Discovered by the IDF in Hamas Hideouts
firstTenSources.originalTitle: Президент Ізраїлю показав «Майн кампф» Гітлера, яку ЦАХАЛ виявив у схованках ХАМАСу

firstTenSources.description: Israeli President Isaac Herzog denies targeting Gaza hospitals, despite reports of closures due to lack of electricity. Battles around hospitals have forced thousands of Palestinians to flee, leaving critically wounded patients and caregivers with dwindling supplies and no electricity.
firstTenSources.title: 'Hamas learnt Hitler's ideology of hating Jews': Israel President Isaac Herzog says fighter found with copy of Mein Kamp

firstTenSources.description: Военные израильской армии показали книгу лидера нацистской Германии Адольфа Гитлера «Майн кампф» (Моя борьба – ред.), которую они якобы нашли в детской спальне, которую боевики ХАМАС использовали как базу в Газе. В пресс-службе ЦАХАЛа рассказали, что книгу на арабском языке с примечаниями и цитатами обнаружили среди личных вещей одного из исламистских террористов. [see_also ids="569667"] «ХАМАС исповедует идеологию Гитлера, ответственного за уни…

firstTenSources.title: Hitler's book in Arabic was found by a Hamas militant. The President of Israel has shown how he looks
firstTenSources.originalTitle: Книгу Гитлера на арабском языке нашли у боевика ХАМАС. Президент Израиля показал, как она выглядит

chatGptSummaries.left:
0. President Itzhak Herzog revealed that a copy of Hitler's "Mein Kampf" in Arabic was found in a children's room in northern Gaza, which was used as a Hamas terror base. The discovery highlights the lingering influence of Hitler's ideology that led to the Holocaust and World War II.
1. The terrorist who owned the book wrote notes, marked sections, and studied Hitler's ideology to fuel hatred and violence against Jews. This emphasizes the real war against hate that we face today.
2. The presence of an explosives lab in the civilian home further proves Hamas's use of civilian areas for terrorist activities in Gaza.
chatGptSummaries.center:
0. Israeli President Isaac Herzog claimed that a copy of Adolf Hitler's Mein Kampf was found on the body of a Hamas fighter in northern Gaza. The book was discovered in a children's room that was being used as a base by Hamas.
1. The discovery of the Arabic-language Mein Kampf with notes and annotations highlights the sources of inspiration for Hamas and their goal of murdering Jews. It also draws attention to the disinformation spread by Hamas regarding electrical services at Shifa Hospital in Gaza.
2. Thousands of Palestinians fled as Israeli troops encircled Al Shifa Hospital, leaving it non-functional. The Israeli military urged Palestinians to use safe corridors, but the mass displacement has occurred, with a significant number of casualties reported on both sides.
chatGptSummaries.right:
0. The Israel Defense Forces (IDF) discovered Adolf Hitler's 'Mein Kampf' book in a children's room used as a base by the terrorist organization Hamas in Gaza. This book, marked with notes and underlining, reveals the deep anti-Semitic hatred and ideology studied by the terrorists.
1. The finding of 'Mein Kampf' demonstrates the sources of inspiration for Hamas and their goal of destroying Jews, reminiscent of the Nazi regime. The Israeli Presidency Spokesperson emphasized that the presence of an explosives lab in a civilian home further proves Hamas's terrorist activity in Gaza.
2. Israel's President warns that if the terrorist threat persists, innocent civilians may face similar attacks to the recent massacre committed by Hamas, underscoring the urgent need to combat this real war against the Jewish population.
chatGptSummaries.analysis:
1. the left and center both emphasize the presence of an explosive lab in a civilian home, highlighting Hamas's use of civilian areas for terrorist activities. the left also emphasizes the real war against hate.
2. the center mentions the meeting between Hitler and the grand mufti of Jerusalem, emphasizing the historical relationship between Nazi ideology and the struggle against a Jewish homeland. This detail is not emphasized in the left and right.
3. the right mentions the recent sneak attack by Hamas that left 1,400 Israelis dead, emphasizing the impact of the conflict.
